data.name: Numberic Anagrams
data.description:
Consider a "number" as any sequence of digits from `0` to `9`.
For any number with at least two different digits, there are other numbers with the same digits but in different orders.
For example, the number `401` can be reordered as `[014, 041, 104, 140, 401, 410]`.
Your task is to return the number at position `x` of the number `n` decomposed in ascending order.
Example:
Input number `n`: `201`
Position `x`: `1`
Output: `21`
Because `201` decomposed in ascending order `[012, 021, 102, 120, 201, 210]` and at position `1` it is `021`. The numbers inside `n` will never have repeated digits such as `112` or `121`, only unique digits such as `1234567890`. This kata was inspired by Alphabetic Anagrams
